snippet: Speaking at the University of California, Irvine, President Obama likened those who deny climate change to people who would have told John F. Kennedy, at the dawn of the space program, that the moon “was made of cheese.”
abstract: Pres Obama, delivering commencement speech at the University of California at Irvine, ridicules members of Congress who deny climate change or plead scientific ignorance as an alibi for avoiding an uncomfortable truth; saves his most scathing words for lawmakers who say they are not qualified to judge issue because they are not scientist but also refuse to rely on information from scientific experts who are highly qualified to advise on topic.
lead_paragraph: Speaking at the University of California, Irvine, President Obama likened those who deny climate change to people who would have told John F. Kennedy, at the dawn of the space program, that the moon “was made of cheese.”

headline.main: At Commencement, Obama Mocks Lawmakers Who Deny Climate Change
headline.print_headline: At Commencement, Obama Mocks Lawmakers Who Deny Climate Change
